title: The Apprentice fans rejoice as Souleyman Bah gets fired after his incessant moaning
text:

The Apprentice returned to BBC One tonight with it's third episode as Lord Sugar continued his hunt for the ultimate new business venture.

And fans were relieved when contestant Souleyman Bah, 20, became the third contestant to be fired from the process this series during Tuesday's week three episode.

The remaining 14 stars joined the hard-talking business mogul at London's Cambridge Theatre and were tasked with brainstorming a new toy for six to eight year olds and creating an online advert to promote it.

Souleyman was part of the losing team, Unison, who failed to impress with their interactive animal children's toy.

Team leader Riyonn slammed Souleyman for being negative throughout the task, whereas the sportsman felt that the rest of his team didn't listen to his opinion.

Lord Sugar's associate Claude Littner supported Riyonn's claim.

He said: "He was negative throughout and didn't come up with any solutions to any problems, which in business is what you need to do."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

After using Souleyman's own words against him 'I can be too over critical", multi-millionaire Sugar fired the contestant.

The Apprentice viewers took to Twitter to reveal their thoughts' on the latest booted off contestant.

One user shared: "Souleyman needs to go. So negative the whole episode. Whine, whine, whine."

(Image: BBC)

Another wrote: "Souleyman was the right person to go althought to be fair it was very close between him and Riyonn."

A third posted: "Souleyman didn't generate solutions."

Souleyman's axing comes as The Apprentice's first ever disabled candidate slammed Lord Sugar for being "patronising" over his disability.

He was diagnosed with a rare eye condition, called Retina Pigmentosa, at the age of 6 which renders him visually impaired.

(Image: BBC)

Souleyman, who is a member of the Great Britain Paralympic Team, has confessed he was "relieved" to be fired because of the "stressful environment".

Speaking to Mirror Online, the para-athlete admitted he took offence to a comment Lord Sugar made when he was fired.

"Just one complaint for me. I didn’t like the comment he made when he fired me calling me ‘brave’.

"He’s never said that to a candidate before and I think me ironically being the only disabled one I felt patronised because you get that a lot when you’re disabled. ‘You’re really brave for trying this. You tried your best’.
description: Contestant Souleyman Bah became the third contestant to be fired from the BBC show, during tonight's week three episode
